c74object.name: fl.fft~
c74object.digest: Calculate the real or complex Fast Fourier Transform of the input(s)
c74object.description: All FFTs use a power of two size, with zero-padding applied at the input(s) if necessary. The output length and expected input lengths depend on the mode parameter. The mode parameter selects either real or complex FFTs and the output type. Real and imaginary values are output as separate frames. For complex FFTs two inputs are provided for real and imaginary values respectively.

entry.name: /max_length [instantiation int]
entry.description: Sets the maximum input length and FFT size.

entry.name: /normalise [instantiation bool]
entry.description: Sets normalisation on or off (such that a full-scale real sine wave produces an amplitude of 1).

entry.name: /mode [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Sets the type of input expected and the output produced:
[0] - real - real input (power of two length) and output without reflection (length is N / 2 + 1).[1] - complex - complex input (two frames) with the same (power of two) input and output lengths.[2] - full_spectrum - real input and output of the same (power of two) length with spectral reflection.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.fft~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.fft~. When set to 0 fl.fft~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.fft~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
